questions.text: Postmenopausal women are susceptible to primary osteoporosis since osteoporosis is closely related to estrogen deficiency. During the menopausal transition period, the drop of estrogen leads to more bone resorption than formation, resulting in osteoporosis. Which of the following drugs is given by nasal route for treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Calcitonin Calcitonin is a polypeptide hormone produced by the thyroid gland. Calcitonin preparations are approved by the FDA for Paget's disease, hypercalcemia, and osteoporosis in postmenopausal women. Calcitonin at a dose of 2-8 U/kg body weight has been used iv/sc/im for the treatment of acute hypercalcemia. It acts within hours of its administration. It is no longer effective in lowering calcium after 24 hours of starting the drug due to tachyphylaxis. A nasal spray containing calcitonin (200U/d) is available for the treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis.

questions.text: Hypocalcemia, also known as calcium deficiency disease, occurs when the blood has low levels of calcium. questions.explanation:

Inverse relation with Mg++ levels Inverse relation with Mg++ levels is not seen in hypocalcemia.
